text.予定を完璧に守る理由…あの時、\r\n大切なことに気づかせてくれて\r\nありが:
Thank you for reminding 
me of what was so 
important at that moment… 
the reason why I kept my 
schedule perfectly.
text.これからも、私が間違えていたら\r\n教えてください。貴方は、私には\r\nない:
Please continue to tell 
me if I am wrong. You 
have a perspective that I 
do not have.
text.…このプランならトレーナーさんも\r\n私もしっかり楽しめるはず。\r\n次は…:
…I'm sure the trainer and 
I will have a good time 
with this plan. Next 
time… I'll have to ask 
her out properly.
text.ドイツでは、お正月はあまり大きく\r\n扱われません。日本の様々な\r\n伝統あ:
In Germany, New Year's is 
not a big deal. The 
various traditional 
rituals in Japan are 
interesting.
text.ケーキ屋の娘の誇りにかけて…\r\n今日のSchokoladeは\r\nいつも以:
With all the pride of a 
cake baker's daughter, 
today's Schokolade must 
be finished with more 
care than usual.
text.完璧な調理…そして親愛の気持ちを\r\n込めました。特製ザッハトルテ、\r\n受:
Perfectly prepared… and 
very dearly loved. Please 
accept our special 
Sachertorte.
text.七夕のことはファルコンさんに\r\n教わりました。私の願いは…目標へ\r\n一直:
I learned about Tanabata 
from Ms. Falcon. My wish 
is… that I may advance 
in a straight line toward 
my goal.
text.せっかくのハロウィンですが、私が\r\n悪戯されることはないでしょう。\r\nお:
It's Halloween, but 
I won't be trick-or-treating. 
I've prepared all 
the candy I can.
text.クリスマスは昔から好きなんです。\r\n父のケーキを買って帰るお客さんは\r\n:
I have always loved 
Christmas. I remember the 
happy smiles on the faces 
of all the customers who 
bought my father's cakes 
to take home.
text.貴方さえよければ、今日お時間を\r\nいただきたいのですが。…今日は、\r\n大:
If you don't mind, I'd 
like to take some time 
today. …because today is 
the day I spend with my 
loved ones.
text.故郷では年末をパーティーで盛大に\r\n祝い新年を迎えるんです。Guten\r\:
In my hometown, we 
celebrate the end of the 
year with a big party to 
welcome the New Year.
text.お誕生日おめでとうございます。\r\nケーキの美味しいカフェがあります\r\nの:
Happy Birthday! There 
is a cafe that serves 
delicious cakes, if 
you would like to join 
us later.
text.両親から特製レシピを聞いて\r\nおきました。誕生日ケーキ、\r\n楽しみにして:
I asked my parents for 
their special recipe. 
Please look forward to 
the birthday cake.
text.自分の生まれた日…己を見つめ\r\n人生のスケジュールを\r\n再確認できる大事:
The day you were born… an 
important day to look at 
yourself and reconfirm 
the schedule of your life.
text.誕生日はいつにも増して両親の顔を\r\n思い出します…2人の誇れる娘で\r\nあ:
On my birthday, I 
remember my parents' 
faces more than ever… I 
want to continue to be a 
daughter they can be 
proud of.
text.貴方にお知らせが来ています。\r\n今後の予定のためにも、\r\n忘れないうちに:
You have been notified. 
Check it before you 
forget for your future 
plans.
text.貴方にGeschenk…プレゼントが\r\n来ています。中身はなんでしょう？: Geschenk… a present for \nyou. What's inside?
text.予定通りのミッション消化…\r\nさすがですね。努力と達成の証、\r\nしっかり:
You completed your 
mission on schedule… as 
expected. I'm sure you'll 
receive the proof of your 
efforts and 
accomplishments.
text.もうすぐイベントが開催されます。\r\nしっかり楽しむためにも、\r\n予定を立:
The event will be held 
soon. Please plan 
accordingly so that you 
can enjoy them to the 
fullest.
text.イベントが開催中です。\r\nイベント、いわばカーニバル…\r\n体が疼いてきま:
The event is underway. 
Events, a carnival, 
so to speak… It makes 
my body tingle.
text.…少し、体が重いですね。\r\nスケジュールを調整すべき\r\nでしょうか…。: I feel a little heavy. \nShould I adjust my \nschedule?
text.休息の時間を作る必要が\r\nありそうです…。: I will need to make time \nfor rest…
text.絶好調というのでしょうか…ふふ。\r\n貴方の指導のおかげで、\r\nスケジュー:
I guess you could say I'm 
on a roll… heh. Thanks to 
your guidance, we'll be 
on schedule.
text.素晴らしいコンディションです。\r\nあとは計画通り進んでいくだけ…！: Excellent condition. Now \nwe just need to keep \ngoing as planned…!
text.いい調子…期待していた通りの\r\n成果が得られそうです。:
Good shape… looks like 
it's going to deliver 
exactly what I was 
hoping for.
text.さて、プラン通りに始めましょう。\r\n充実したトレーニングになりそう\r\nで:
Now, let's start 
following the plan. It's 
going to be a great 
training session.
text.調子は良好です。\r\n予定通りのメニューを\r\n消化していけるかと。:
I am in good shape. I 
think I will be able to 
digest the menu as 
planned.
text.今のペースなら、\r\n現行のスケジュールで\r\n問題はなさそうですね。: At the current pace, \nthe current schedule \nseems fine.
text.なぜでしょう…少し気怠く…。\r\n調整が必要かもしれません…。: I don't know why… \na bit lazy… Maybe \nI need to adjust…
text.トレーニングの予定なのに…\r\n体が少し重いんです。: I'm supposed to be \ntraining… but my body is \na little heavy.
text.うぅん…どうも、尻尾の毛並みまで\r\n乱れているような気がします…。: Hmmm… I think even the \nfur on her tail seems to \nbe disheveled…
text.モチベーションのコントロールが\r\nうまくいきません…。: I am having trouble \ncontrolling my motivation…
text.…今日もレースというのは、\r\nスケジュールに無理があるかと…。: …I think it's too much to \nask for a race today…
text.レース続きになると、\r\n今後のプランにも影響が…。: The race to the finish \nline will affect our \nfuture plans…
text.Sturm und Drang…！\r\n正直、ウズウズしています…！: Sturm und Drang…! To be \nhonest, I'm itching to…!
text.計画に寸分の狂いもなく…まさに\r\n理想的なコンディションです。\r\n勝利に:
We are in perfect 
condition… no deviations 
from the plan. We have no 
worries about winning.
text.時間をかけ、貴方と予定を\r\n作ってきた甲斐がありました。\r\n…目的を果た:
It was worth the time and 
effort to make plans with 
you. …I will fulfill my 
purpose.
text.体調よし、メンタルよし、\r\n尻尾のカットよし…。\r\nまさしく、準備万全で:
Physical condition is 
good, mental condition 
is good, tail cut is 
good… We are just about 
ready to go.
text.予定通り、良い状態で臨めますね。\r\nあとは結果を出すだけです。: We are on schedule and in \ngood shape. Now we just \nneed to get results.
text.おかげで調整もうまくいきました。\r\n私も貴方に恥じない走りを。:
Thanks to you, the 
adjustment went well. I 
will not be ashamed to 
run as well as you.
text.…心配はいりません。\r\nやってきたことに間違いは\r\nなかったと証明してき: Don't worry. We will \nprove that we have done \neverything right.
text.toi,toi,toi…よし。\r\nそれでは、行きましょうか。: TOI, TOI, TOI… okay. \nLet's go, then.
text.おおむねスケジュール通りですね。\r\n目標達成は十分狙えます。:
We are generally on 
schedule. We are well 
on target to achieve 
our goals.
text.ベストの状態ではありませんが…\r\n目標は見失っていません。: We are not at our best… \nbut we have not lost \nsight of our goal.
text.少々予定は狂いましたが、\r\nまだ挽回は…可能です。: We're a little off \nschedule, but we can \nstill make up for it.
text.不調は否めませんね…。\r\nとにかく今の全力を出してきます。: I can't deny that I'm in \na slump… Anyway, I will \ngive it my all now.
text.想定外の事態になりました…\r\nですが、落ち込む前にまずは\r\nしっかり走ら:
This is an unexpected 
situation… But before I 
get depressed, I have to 
run well first…
text.今は両親に恥じないよう\r\n最後まで走り切る…それだけです。:
Now, I will run to the 
end so that I don't 
disgrace my parents… 
that's all I can do.
text.どうも集中できません…\r\nしかし走れないわけでは。: I can't concentrate… \nbut that doesn't mean \nI can't run.
text.これまでのこと、感謝します。: Thank you for all you \nhave done so far.
text.誇れるレースでした。: It was a race to \nbe proud of.
text.及第点…次はさらに上へ。: A passing grade… next \ntime, go even higher.
text.スケジュールをもっと整理しないと…。: I need to organize my \nschedule better…
text.計画を…1から見直さなければなりませんね…。: We need to rethink our \nplans… from the ground up…
text.応援してくれた皆さんに\r\n感謝をお返ししてきます。: I'm going to return the \ngratitude to all of you \nwho have supported me.
text.私のトレーナーになるのは予め\r\n決まっていた…と仰いましたね。\r\nそうか:
You said you had already 
decided that you would 
be my trainer. Maybe… 
maybe. Hmmm.
text.Guten Morgen.\r\n朝はどうしても慌ただしくなりがち\r\nですね: Mornings tend to be \nhectic. Preparation the \nday before is essential.
text.日本の朝食といえば…\r\n納豆ですよね。\r\n私、大好きなんです。: Speaking of Japanese \nbreakfast… Natto, right? \nI love it.
text.食事は25分30秒で済ませ、復習を\r\n…と、いけない。ファルコンさんと\r\:
I finished my meal in 25 
minutes and 30 seconds, 
and reviewed… oh no. I 
was supposed to meet Ms. 
Falcon for lunch.
text.…毎日、8秒。カフェテリアに\r\n新作のデザートが並んでいないかの\r\nチェ:
…every day for eight 
seconds. That's the time 
I use to check the 
cafeteria for new 
desserts.
text.予定の再確認に4分、家族と友人を\r\n想うのに5分…ベッドに入り\r\n眠るま:
Four minutes to reconfirm 
plans, five minutes to 
think of family and 
friends… we make the most 
of the time we have 
before we go to bed and 
fall asleep.
text.今日も終わってしまいますね…。\r\n1日の反省と明日の予定作り、\r\n未来に:
Today is ending… Let's 
reflect on the day, make 
plans for tomorrow, and 
prepare for the future.
text.昔から、春の花々には敬意を\r\n払っています。厳しい冬を耐え、\r\n毎年きち:
I have always admired 
spring flowers. The way 
they endure the harsh 
winters and bloom 
properly every year… it's 
magnificent.
text.熱中症のリスクは常に存在します。\r\n水分補給のスケジュール表を作り、\r\n:
The risk of heat stroke 
is always present. Create 
a hydration schedule 
and carry your own water 
bottle.
text.ドイツの秋といえば…やはり\r\nオクトーバーフェストですね。\r\nぜひ1度、:
Autumn in Germany is the 
time for Oktoberfest. I 
would like to invite you 
to Oktoberfest.
text.冬はどうしても屋内にいる時間が\r\n長くなりますね。…新作ケーキの\r\nレシ:
In winter, we tend to 
spend more time indoors. 
Let's start developing 
recipes for new cakes, 
shall we?
text.メトロノームに合わせ鼻歌を歌って\r\nいたら、背後にファルコンさんが…\r\n:
I was humming along to 
the metronome when Ms. 
Falcon came up behind me… 
I was so surprised that I 
just screamed…
text.あれだけの交友関係を無理なく\r\n維持できるとは…ジョーダンさんは\r\nスケ:
I think Ms. Jordan may be 
a master at managing her 
schedule to keep up with 
that many friendships 
without strain.
text.ナカヤマさんの勝負への姿勢は\r\n私とは対極的ですが、だからこそ\r\n学ぶも:
Your attitude toward 
competition is the opposite 
of mine, but I think 
that's why I have something 
to learn from you.
text.ゴルシさんとケーキ店を巡ったの\r\nですが…いつの間にか駄菓子\r\n掴み取り:
Golsi and I toured a cake 
store, but before we knew 
it, it had turned into a 
candy-collecting tour.
text.映画は好きですが、ゾンビだけは…\r\n腐敗した遺体があんなに動ける\r\nはず:
I like movies, but only 
zombies… It's strange 
that decomposing corpses 
can't move like that…!
text.ステップ1つに至るまで完璧に…\r\n観客の皆さんにも一緒に走った相手\r\nに:
I want to make sure that 
every single step is 
perfect… I want to show 
respect to the audience 
and to the people I ran 
with.
text.元々カーニバルは大好きですから。\r\nこの衣装を着て踊れると思うと、\r\n心:
I have always loved 
carnivals. The thought of 
dancing in this costume 
makes my heart sing. Hmmm.
text.ふわふわしていながら、\r\n激しい動きにも耐えられる\r\n丈夫な造り…素晴ら: Fluffy, yet sturdy enough \nto withstand strenuous \nactivity… a great outfit.
text.完璧にフィットするサイズ…\r\nこれを作ってくださった\r\nマイスターの腕に:
Perfectly sized to fit… 
I admire the skill of 
the master craftsman 
who made it.
text.開店前のお店に漂う\r\n作りたてのお菓子の匂い…\r\n時々、実家が懐かしくな:
The smell of freshly 
made sweets wafting through 
the store before it opens 
sometimes makes me nostalgic 
for my parents' house.
text.ドイツでは昼食がメインなんです。\r\n今でもその習慣は変えていません。\r\n:
In Germany, lunch is the 
main thing. Even now, I 
haven't changed that 
habit. It is also 
reasonable for exercise.
text.秒単位でセットできる目覚ましが\r\nあるとよいのですが…結局、\r\n体内時計:
It would be nice to have 
an alarm that can be set 
to wake me up in seconds… 
but in the end, my body 
clock may be the best.
text.テントウムシに会える\r\n季節になりました。\r\n…かわいいですよね…。: It's the season to \nsee ladybugs. They \nare so cute…
text.さすがに暑いですね…。\r\n湖に行きたいところですが、\r\nここはプールで涼:
It is indeed very hot… I 
would like to go to the 
lake, but let's cool off 
at the pool.
text.スポーツの秋、ですか。それなら\r\n私は…サッカーがしたいですね。\r\nよけ:
Autumn is the season for 
sports, isn't it? Then I 
would like to play 
soccer. If you don't 
mind, I'd like to play 
with you.
text.雪が降ると、シュトレンを思い出し\r\nますね…。クリスマスの時期は、\r\n毎: Snow reminds me of \nStollen… I used to help \nmake them every Christmas.
text.共に、目標への道を\r\n歩んでいきましょう。\r\nまずは計画、ですね。: Let's work together \nto reach our goals. \nFirst, a plan.
text.スケジュール確認、よし。\r\n今日も始めていきましょう。: Schedule confirmed, okay. \nLet's get started today.
text.目指す場所は遠くとも、\r\n着実に予定を立て、\r\n辿り着いてみせます。: We may be far away, but \nwe have a steady schedule \nand we will get there.
text.もちろん準備は済んでいます。\r\nご指導のほど、お願いします。: Of course we are already \nprepared. Thank you for \nyour guidance.
text.新鮮ですね…。ドイツでは\r\n海水浴より湖水浴の方が\r\nメジャーなんです。: It's fresh… In Germany, \nlake bathing is more \npopular than sea bathing.
text.貴方となら、目標に辿り着けると…\r\n心から信じています。: I truly believe that \nwith you, we will \nreach our goal.
text.一緒に計画を詰めて行きましょう。\r\n貴方を、頼りにしています。: Let's work together to \nfinalize a plan. We are \ncounting on you.
text.もし私の不器用さが\r\nまた出ていると思ったら、\r\n遠慮なく教えてください: If you think I'm being \nclumsy again, feel free \nto let me know.
text.今は自分を、心から誇れます…。: Now I can be truly proud \nof myself…
text.私だけでは、きっとここまで\r\n来られませんでした。: I am sure I could \nnot have made it this \nfar on my own.
text.着実に1歩ずつ…目標へ。: Steadily one step at a \ntime… to the goal.
text.目指すべき自分へ、歩を進めます。: We will walk forward \nto the person we should \naim to be.
text.エイシンフラッシュです。\r\n共に誇りある勝利へ。: This is Eishin Flash. \nTogether, to a proud \nvictory.
text.完璧なスケジュールこそが、\r\n勝利への道です。: A perfect schedule is the \npath to victory.
text.詰めが甘かったですね。: I didn't pack it in well.
text.勝利への歩みに、1歩たりとも狂いなし…\r\n今こそ成就の時！: Not a single step to \nvictory… Now is the time \nfor fulfillment!
text.貴方と立てたスケジュールに…\r\n狂いはありませんでした。: The schedule that we set \nup with you… it was \nflawless.
text.明日はこちらがもらえる予定です。: We will be getting this \none tomorrow.
text.さて、\r\n今回のトレーニング予定は…。: Now, let's see, what is \nthe training schedule \nthis time…
text.学園の歴史と伝統…\r\nぜひ学んでおきましょう。:
The history and 
traditions of the school… 
we encourage you to learn 
about them.
text.目標に向け、\r\n確実に経験を積んでいきたいです。: I would like to gain \nexperience to achieve \nmy goal.
text.ウマ娘名鑑のレベルが上がった\r\nようです。ご確認を。:
It seems that the 
level of the horsegirl 
directory has been 
raised. Please check 
it out.
text.スケジュールは厳守、ですよ。: The schedule is strictly \nadhered to, you know.
text.お力添えいたします。: We will be happy to \nassist you.
text.慌てる必要はありません。: There is no need to panic.
text.期待通りの成果かと。: I thought the results \nwere as expected.
text.学園の伝統をまとっている自覚を\r\n持っていきたいですね。: I would like to be aware \nthat I am wearing the \ntraditions of the school.
text.学業とレースの両立…\r\n学生ならば当然のことです。: Balancing schoolwork and \nracing… a natural thing \nfor students to do.
text.ステージの上での姿、\r\n両親にも見せたいです。: I want my parents to see \nme on stage.
text.誇りと勇気が湧いてくるようです。: It seems to inspire pride \nand courage.
text.もちろんサイズは完璧。\r\n寸分の狂いもありません。: Of course the size is \nperfect. Not an inch out \nof place.
text.互いの誇りをかけ…\r\n正々堂々、勝負です。: We will put our pride on \nthe line… and play fair \nand square.
text.おはようございます。1日を\r\n始めるおまじないを、ご一緒に。\r\n…Ich:
Good morning, and I hope 
you'll join me for a 
spell to start your day. 
…Ich gebe mein Bestes!
text.皆と挨拶を交わすたびに\r\n美味しそうな匂いがすると…\r\n原因は朝に焼いた:
Every time you say hello 
to everyone, you say you 
smell something 
delicious… and the cause 
is the cookies you baked 
in the morning.
text.糖分摂取は、午後を頑張るためにも\r\n有効です。ただし、くれぐれも\r\n計画:
Sugar intake is also a 
good way to get through 
the afternoon. But be 
sure to plan ahead.
text.忙しくても、必ず休憩はとる。\r\nよい仕事をこなす秘訣だと、\r\n父は言って:
Even if you are busy, 
always take a break. My 
father used to say that 
this was the secret of 
doing a good job.
text.この時間にお菓子は禁物です。\r\nもし食べたくても、\r\n明日まで我慢…です:
Sweets are not allowed at 
this time. Even if you 
want to eat them, you 
have to wait until 
tomorrow.
text.生地の仕込みは完了。\r\nあとは冷蔵庫で12時間寝かせて…\r\nふふ、楽しみ:
The dough is ready. Now 
it's time to put it in 
the fridge for 12 hours… 
Hmmm… look forward to it.
text.桜を見ていると、両親との花見を\r\n思い出しますね…ふふ、実は\r\nドイツに:
Cherry blossoms remind me 
of cherry blossom viewing 
with my parents… 
Actually, there are rows 
of cherry trees in 
Germany as well.
text.今年も暑くなりましたね…\r\nしかしご安心を。冷たいケーキ、\r\nKalte:
It's been hot again 
this year… but don't 
worry. I made a cold 
cake, Kalter Hund.
text.最近は、なるべく低カロリーの\r\nお菓子を模索しています。食欲の秋\r\nとい:
Recently, I have been 
searching for snacks that 
are as low in calories as 
possible. Even though it 
is autumn, I have to keep 
a tight control on my 
appetite.
text.基本的にお菓子は熱を冷ましたもの\r\nが多いですが、食べれば心は\r\n温まる:
Basically, most sweets 
are made to cool down the 
heat, but if you eat 
them, your heart will be 
warmed… it's a strange 
thing, isn't it?
text.ファルコンさん、私の服の匂いで\r\n作ったお菓子を言い当てるんです。\r\nな:
Ms. Falcon, she can tell 
what candy I made by the 
smell of my clothes. It's 
kind of embarrassing…
text.新作を作るとバクシンオーさんが\r\n必ず現れて試食してくださいます。\r\n助:
Whenever I make a new 
product, Bakushin O 
always shows up and 
tastes it. It's very 
helpful… but where in the 
world did she come from…?
text.最近、手作りのケーキを\r\nフラワーさんと交換しています。\r\n優しい味で…:
Lately I've been swapping 
homemade cakes with Ms. 
Flower. It tastes so 
tender… and so comforting.
text.成してきた全てを問われる点では、\r\nレースもパティシエの仕事も\r\n同じ…:
I believe that both 
racing and patissier work 
are equally challenging 
in terms of everything 
you have achieved.
text.誕生日など、特別な日を彩るのも\r\nパティシエの仕事。ならば私は…\r\n走り:
It is the pastry chef's 
job to color special 
occasions such as 
birthdays. Then I will… I 
will color the race with 
my running.
text.職人とは本来、厳しい修行を経て\r\n与えられる称号。この衣装の持つ\r\n重み:
A craftsman is 
essentially a title given 
after rigorous training. 
I would like to keep in 
mind the importance of 
this costume.
text.この衣装を着ていると、\r\n作品に向かう意欲が湧いて…\r\nなんだかレース前:
When I wear this outfit, 
I feel motivated to work 
on the piece… it's kind 
of like before a race.
text.朝は、その日全ての準備を\r\n完了させる時間…\r\nパティシエの鉄則です。:
The morning is the time 
to complete all the day's 
preparations… an ironclad 
rule for pastry chefs.
text.食後のデザートか、間食か…\r\n同じお菓子でも、タイミングで\r\n内容をアレ:
Whether it's an 
after-dinner dessert or a 
snack… even if it's the 
same snack, we need to 
rearrange the timing and 
the content.
text.Konditor…パティシエの1日は\r\n夜に始まっているともいえます。\r\:
Konditor… It could be 
said that a pastry chef's 
day begins at night. We 
have to prepare for 
tomorrow's event.
text.お花見の季節…雪ではなく、\r\n桜をイメージしたシュトレンを\r\n作ってみる:
In the season of cherry 
blossom viewing, it would 
be nice to make a stollen 
with the image of cherry 
blossoms instead of snow.
text.ドイツを旅するなら夏が最適です。\r\n機会があれば、案内いたしますよ。\r\n:
Summer is the best time 
to travel in Germany. If 
we have the opportunity, 
we will show you around. 
Let us help you make your 
schedule.
text.栗拾いに出かけたいですね…。\r\n美味しそうなモンブランのレシピを\r\n思い:
I would love to go out 
to pick chestnuts… I just 
came up with a recipe 
for a delicious looking 
Mont Blanc.
text.バレンタインにクリスマス…\r\nお菓子の出番が近づくと\r\n気が引き締まりま:
Valentine's Day, 
Christmas… When the time 
comes for sweets to be 
served, we are all in a 
state of excitement.
text.準備は完璧。では、Öffnen…\r\n開店といきましょうか。: Everything is ready. \nSo, Öffnen… let's \nopen the store.
text.レースにおいてもマイスターの\r\n境地へ…きっと達してみせます。: In racing, too, I will \nreach the level of a \nmaster… I promise.
text.勝利という作品を完成させるまで、\r\n1つ1つの工程を、精確に。:
We will be precise in 
every step of the 
process, until we have 
completed our work of 
triumph.
text.美味しさと栄養の両立…\r\nプロテインクッキーには\r\nかなりの可能性を感じ:
I see quite a bit of 
potential in protein 
cookies… both in taste 
and nutrition.
text.今はただ全力を尽くすことに\r\n集中し…終わったら、共に\r\n甘味を楽しみま:
For now, let's just focus 
on doing the best we can… 
and when we're done, 
we'll enjoy the sweet 
treats together.
text.勝利の味をトレーナーさんにも\r\n味わっていただくため、\r\n下ごしらえは欠:
Preparation is essential 
so that the trainers can 
enjoy the taste of 
victory.
text.力を合わせ、最高の結果を\r\n生み出したいものですね――\r\n両親が厨房でそ:
We want to work together 
to produce the best 
results - just as my 
parents did in the 
kitchen.
text.私も立派なマイスターになれたでしょうか。: I hope I have become a \nworthy Meister.
text.職人としての新境地、\r\n見えた気がします。: I think I have found a \nnew frontier as a \ncraftsman.
text.エイシンフラッシュです。\r\n突き詰めた最高の味をお届けします。:
Eishin Flash. We bring 
you the best taste 
of the best that we 
have to offer.
text.厨房に立つ両親の姿を思い出しますね…。: It reminds me of my \nparents standing in the \nkitchen…
text.幼い頃に憧れた衣装…\r\nどこか、夢を見ているようです。: The costumes I adored as \na child… Somewhere, I \nseem to be dreaming.
text.真心と細心。軽妙にして玄妙。\r\n未体験の味を…ご堪能ください。:
Sincerity and attention 
to detail. Light and 
subtle. Please enjoy the 
taste that you have never 
experienced before.
text.積み上げた味を、召し上がれ。: The taste that we have \nbuilt up, please enjoy.
text.レシピ、計量、調理…全て完璧。\r\n積み上げた味を、召し上がれ。:
Recipes, measurements, 
cooking… all perfect. The 
taste that we have built 
up, please enjoy.
text.勝利のレシピ通り…\r\n美味しく仕上がりましたね。: As per your winning \nrecipe… it turned out \ndelicious.
text.完璧なレシピを完璧な手順で。\r\n日頃の感謝の証です。\r\n必ずや優勝してみ:
Perfect recipe with 
perfect instructions. 
It's a testament to our 
daily appreciation. We 
will make sure you win.
text.時間は限られています。\r\n心をくすぐる適切なモチーフを、\r\n迅速に見つけ:
Time is limited. We 
must quickly find the 
right motifs to tickle 
our fancy.
text.この学園の真髄を感じ…\r\nWunderbar――\r\n素晴らしいの一言です: I felt the essence of \nthis academy… Wunderbar― \none word: excellent.
text.結果は残念でしたが、両親には、\r\n貴重な経験ができたと報告\r\nしたいです:
Although the result was 
disappointing, I would 
like to report to my 
parents that it was a 
valuable experience for 
me. I hope I will be able 
to do it again next time.
text.イベントミッションはこちら\r\nです。多岐にわたるため、緻密な\r\nプランニ:
The event mission is 
here. Due to the variety 
of missions, detailed 
planning is recommended.
